description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programmes. [P&M, HACT], which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Afghanistan (Adolescent Health and Development)
Afghanistan Country Programme Document 2015-2019 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Afghanistan 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programmes. [P&M, HACT]

description.narrative: Programme Planning & Monitoring was strengthened in the first half of the year with a Programme Retreat where the office examined ways to work better together, discussed strategic partnerships, and agreed on AMP priorities for 2020. The third-party monitoring pilot was rolled out in the Southern and Eastern Regions with Paktika added in June for Community Based Education projects. 2,261 sites were visited. Adjustments were made to the programme structure so that results and expenditures could be separately tracked. eTools and UNPP have been fully rolled out. The Partnership Review Committee approved approximately US$25 million in the first six months. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/07/2020

title.narrative: Value and proportion of OR (ORR and ORE) funds not utilized before grant expiration in current year
Third party monitoring rolled out in at least 2 regions
Utilization of ORR allocated for use in the current year
Monthly salary for both national and international staff processed on time by 15th and 20th of every month respectively
Draft 2022-2025 Country Programme Document and Programme Strategy Notes developed by Dec 2020

actual.value: 2020:All partnerships being done through UNPP and staff using eTools.
